backend/main.mo: Motoko canister actor defining the core domain model and types for the app, including activities, reminders, todos, finance, habits, journals, dashboards, user profiles, themes, languages, and access control structures.
feature_evidence.json: Machine-readable report documenting implemented frontend features, affected files, dependencies, test requirements, and confidence levels for recent dashboard and mobile UI changes.
frontend-file-summaries.txt: Prewritten high-level summaries of frontend source files describing each componentâ€™s purpose, layout behavior, authentication guards, and styling conventions.
frontend/index.css: Global Tailwind CSS configuration defining light and dark theme variables, OKLCH color tokens, chart colors, sidebar styles, and shared base styles.
frontend/index.html: HTML entry point that sets viewport metadata, page title, root mounting element, and loads the React application bundle.
frontend/src/App.tsx: Root React component managing theme, authentication state, profile setup modal, and switching between Daily View and Main Dashboard layouts.
frontend/src/components/AppButton.tsx: Reusable button wrapper around the base UI Button component that standardizes styling and forwards refs.
frontend/src/components/CalendarView.tsx: Interactive monthly calendar component with month navigation, today selection, date highlighting, and reminder indicators integrated with authentication state.
frontend/src/components/DailyDashboard.t: Renders the daily dashboard view with a formatted date header and tabbed sections for overview, activities, finance, habits, and journal based on a selected date.
frontend/src/components/Footer.tsx: Simple footer component displaying a muted copyright notice and visual separation from the main content.
frontend/src/components/Header.tsx: Top navigation bar handling app branding, view switching (main vs daily), theme toggling, authentication state, and user menu with profile and logout actions.
frontend/src/components/LoginButton.tsx: Login button component that initiates Internet Identity authentication, handles loading state, and retries login on stale sessions.
frontend/src/components/MainDashboard.ts: Main analytics dashboard showing trends over the last 7 or 30 days, including finance, habits, income/expenses, investments, and time-spent charts.
frontend/src/components/ProfileSetupModa: Modal dialog for creating or repairing a user profile by setting a username, with form validation and backend persistence.
frontend/src/components/sections/DailyOv: Displays a per-day summary with pie charts for activities, finances, and habits completion, aggregating data fetched for the selected date.
frontend/src/components/sections/Finance: Daily finance management section allowing users to create, delete, summarize, and visualize income, expenses, and investments for a selected date.
frontend/src/components/sections/HabitsS: React section that displays daily habits, allows creating, toggling completion, and deleting habits, and visualizes completion progress with a pie chart. It relies on Internet Identity for authentication and react-query hooks for CRUD operations.
frontend/src/components/sections/Journal: Daily journal section that loads, edits, and saves a text journal entry for a selected date. It supports create/update flows via react-query and requires Internet Identity to enable saving.
frontend/src/components/sections/Overvie: Time-based activities section that lists daily activities and allows creating and deleting them through a dialog form. It computes and displays activity durations and requires authentication for mutations.
frontend/src/components/sections/Reminde: Section for managing reminders for a specific date, including listing, creating, and deleting reminders. Uses dialog-based input, react-query hooks, and Internet Identity checks.
frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts: Custom hook that creates and caches a backend actor instance based on the current Internet Identity using react-query. It reinitializes access control, handles anonymous actors, and invalidates dependent queries when the actor changes.
frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.t: Authentication context and hook for managing Internet Identity login state, identity persistence, and login/logout actions. It wraps the app with a provider that exposes identity, status flags, and AuthClient integration.
frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts: Defines React Query hooks for fetching and mutating user profiles, activities, finances, habits, journals, reminders, and related data via a backend actor, with authentication checks, cache invalidation, and toast-based error/success handling.
frontend/src/index.css: Configures Tailwind CSS base styles, CSS variables for light/dark themes, section-specific accent colors, and reusable component styles such as dashboard cards with hover effects.
frontend/src/main.tsx: Bootstraps the React application, setting up the React Query client and Internet Identity provider before rendering the root App component.
frontend/src/utils/errors.ts: Provides a utility to normalize backend and runtime errors into clear, user-friendly English messages, handling common authentication and authorization cases.
frontend/src/utils/localDate.ts: Implements local date utilities that work with YYYY-MM-DD strings to avoid timezone issues, including formatting, parsing, ranges, and common date calculations.
frontend/src/utils/urlParams.ts: Contains helpers for reading URL parameters from query strings or hash routes, persisting them in sessionStorage, and safely managing or clearing sensitive parameters.
frontend/tailwind.config.js: Tailwind CSS configuration enabling class-based dark mode, custom color tokens via CSS variables, extended theme settings, animations, and additional plugins.
project_state.json: Project-level state and feature inventory describing DailyOS, a personal daily tracking web app on the Internet Computer with calendar-based UI, analytics, and role-based access control. Captures schema/version info, a high-level product summary, and a structured list of implemented features across auth, backend, and UI.
